title: How to Set Google as Your Default Search Engine: 11 Easy Ways

steps.title: Open Chrome and click ⋮.
steps.content: Open Chrome and click ⋮ . This icon is in the top-right corner of the window. A drop-down menu will appear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu. [2] X Research source Alternatively, you can type chrome://settings in the address bar and press ↵ Enter / ⏎ Return to open your Google Chrome settings.

steps.title: Click Search engine in the sidebar.
steps.content: Click Search engine in the sidebar. It's under Appearance and above Default browser .

steps.title: Click Change next to your current default search engine.
steps.content: Click Change next to your current default search engine. Your current default search engine will be displayed under the "Search engine" heading.

steps.title: Choose "Google" from the list of options.
steps.content: Choose "Google" from the list of options. Click the radio button next to Google and then click the Set as default button to change your search engine. Your Google Chrome settings save automatically.

steps.title: Open the Chrome app and tap ⋮ (Android) or ⋯ (iPhone).
steps.content: Open the Chrome app and tap ⋮ (Android) or ⋯ (iPhone). The button is in the top-right corner of the screen for Android, and the bottom-right corner of the screen for iPhone. A menu will appear. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . On Android, this option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. On iPhone, scroll all the way to the right on the horizontally-scrolling menu at the top of the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Search Engine.
steps.content: Tap Search Engine . It's near the top of the page. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . Doing so selects Google as your Chrome search engine. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ← (Android) or Done.
steps.content: Tap ← (Android) or Done . This will save your settings and return you to the last tab that you were on. Skip this step on Android.

steps.title: Open Safari and click Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari and click Safari . This menu item is in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the top of the Safari drop-down menu. This will open the Settings window.

steps.title: Click the Search tab.
steps.content: Click the Search tab. You'll find this at the top of the Settings window. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Search engine" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Search engine" drop-down box. This is at the top of the Search tab. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Google.
steps.content: Click Google . It's in the drop-down menu. This sets Google as Safari's search engine.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. Tap the grey app with gears on it. You'll usually find this on the Home Screen. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari . It's about a third of the way down the page. [10] X Research source If you're on iOS 18 or later, tap Apps > Safari . The Apps menu is organized alphabetically, so Safari will be under the "S" section.

steps.title: Tap Search Engine.
steps.content: Tap Search Engine . You'll find this below the "SEARCH" heading. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . It's at the top of the page. This will set your Safari search engine as Google. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge and click ⋯.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge and click ⋯ . It's in the upper-right corner of the Edge window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. And it has an icon of a cogwheel. [13] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Privacy, search, and services.
steps.content: Click Privacy, search, and services . It's in the left-hand sidebar, and has an icon of a lock.

steps.title: Click Search and connected experiences.
steps.content: Click Search and connected experiences . It's at the bottom of the list of options, and it has an icon of a magnifying glass.

steps.title: Click Address bar and search.
steps.content: Click Address bar and search . It's the second to last option on the menu.

steps.title: Click the dropdown and choose Google.
steps.content: Click the dropdown and choose Google . The dropdown is located next to the label that says "Search engine used in the address bar." Edge will save this setting automatically.

steps.title: Open Firefox and click ☰.
steps.content: Open Firefox and click ☰ . You'll find this on the upper-right side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click the Search tab.
steps.content: Click the Search tab. It's got an icon of a magnifying glass. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Default Search Engine" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Default Search Engine" drop-down box. This is near the top of the window. A drop-down menu will appear. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Click Google.
steps.content: Click Google . Doing so selects Google as your Firefox search engine.

steps.title: Open Firefox and tap ☰ (iPhone) or ⋮ (Android).
steps.content: Open Firefox and tap ☰ (iPhone) or ⋮ (Android). On iPhone, the button is in the bottom-right corner of the screen. On Android, it's in the top-right. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the menu, and it has an icon of a cogwheel. [18] X Research source On iPhone, you may have to swipe left or right across the menu to bring up the Settings option.

steps.title: Tap Search.
steps.content: Tap Search . It's near the top of the page. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the default search engine.
steps.content: Tap the default search engine. You'll see it near the top of the page. Doing so opens a list of available search engines.

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . This will select Google and set it as your Firefox search engine.

steps.title: Open the Samsung Browser app and tap ☰.
steps.content: Open the Samsung Browser app and tap ☰ . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's the last option in the pop-up window, and it has an icon of a cogwheel.

steps.title: Tap Address bar search.
steps.content: Tap Address bar search .

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . Once you have selected Google, tap < to go back and save your selection.

steps.title: Open Opera and click the red O icon.
steps.content: Open Opera and click the red O icon. It's in the top-left corner of the screen. This will open Opera's menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can also press Alt + P to open the Settings menu directly.

steps.title: Type search engine in the search bar at the top of the page.
steps.content: Type search engine in the search bar at the top of the page. This will instantly bring up the option to change your default search engine.

steps.title: Click Change next to your current default search engine.
steps.content: Click Change next to your current default search engine. Your current default search engine will be displayed under the "Search engine" heading.

steps.title: Choose "Google" from the list of options.
steps.content: Choose "Google" from the list of options. Click the radio button next to Google and then click the Set as default button to change your search engine. Your Google Chrome settings save automatically.

steps.title: Open the Opera app and tap ⋮.
steps.content: Open the Opera app and tap ⋮ . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the pop-up menu, and it has an icon of a cogwheel.

steps.title: Tap Default Search Engine.
steps.content: Tap Default Search Engine . You'll need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . Once you're done, tap the button in the upper-left corner of the screen to go back and save your choice.

steps.title: Open the Opera app and tap the icon of a person.
steps.content: Open the Opera app and tap the icon of a person. It's in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Tap the cogwheel icon.
steps.content: Tap the cogwheel icon. It's at the top of the menu, next to the power button icon.

steps.title: Tap Search.
steps.content: Tap Search . You'll have to scroll down to find this option. It has an icon of a magnifying glass.

steps.title: Tap Default search engine.
steps.content: Tap Default search engine . It's at the top of the Search menu.

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . Your choice will automatically be applied and saved.
